page.title: 04M25 Wisley To Leatherhead
page.content: The idea of building the motorway was really first{thought of by the {government in 1930,}but construction did not start until November 1982 on this particular section.{The M25 is {being built as a detour for people {travelling across London because {London is so busy. The M25 is made of two different materials. First hard gravel is put down. This is covered by layers of thin and thick concrete. Some parts are then covered with tarmac. 140,000 tons of concrete was used to build this section. The workmen saved a lot of money by digging gravel from a wood nearby and replacing it with hardcore. The Leatherhead interchange opened 10 months early, in August 1984.{This {section will be open by September {1985. {
